 Ã‚Â³                       Game Notes & Release Information                     Ã‚Â³
 Ã‚Â³                      ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~                    Ã‚Â³
 Ã‚Â³    									      Ã‚Â³	
 Ã‚Â³    If you are interested in why we released this game, when PDM had        Ã‚Â³
 Ã‚Â³    already "released" it, read the News and Announcements section below.   Ã‚Â³
 Ã‚Â³                                                                            Ã‚Â³
 Ã‚Â³    Essentially, the differences between Paradigm&#039;s release and ours is:    Ã‚Â³
 Ã‚Â³                                                                            Ã‚Â³
 Ã‚Â³    1. RAZOR&#039;s supports non-3D cards. Paradigm&#039;s doesn&#039;t.                   Ã‚Â³
 Ã‚Â³    2. Paradigm&#039;s 3DFX support was not cracked properly, and didn&#039;t work.   Ã‚Â³
 Ã‚Â³       Of course, RAZOR&#039;s works flawlessly, first time.                     Ã‚Â³
 Ã‚Â³    3. RAZOR&#039;s version includes all the speech and SFX (which are           Ã‚Â³
 Ã‚Â³       absolutely essential to the game), and still remains under the       Ã‚Â³
 Ã‚Â³       75 disk limit. Paradigm&#039;s initial release was 118 disks              Ã‚Â³
 Ã‚Â³       including an "optional" add-on for speech and still did not          Ã‚Â³
 Ã‚Â³       inlcude all the SFX...you do the arithmetic.                         Ã‚Â³
 Ã‚Â³    4. While listening to "CLASS sucks..." being played throughout the      Ã‚Â³
 Ã‚Â³       game instead of the voices is amusing, it destroys the plot of       Ã‚Â³
 Ã‚Â³       the game. RAZOR&#039;s version includes all the speech, as we strive      Ã‚Â³
 Ã‚Â³       to maintain the playability of our releases.                         Ã‚Â³
 Ã‚Â³                                                                            Ã‚Â³
 Ã‚Â³    You be the judge, but there is simply no contest here.                  Ã‚Â³
 Ã‚Â³                                                                            Ã‚Â³
 Ã‚Â³    For years a secluded mansion and its grounds have been the site of      Ã‚Â³
 Ã‚Â³    top-secret biotechnic experiments.  The research staff has been funded  Ã‚Â³
 Ã‚Â³    by a respected (if slightly unethical) corporation. The weekly          Ã‚Â³
 Ã‚Â³    laboratory reports have been increasingly vague and now they have       Ã‚Â³ 
 Ã‚Â³    stopped completely. Recent gory attacks near the mansion have lead to   Ã‚Â³
 Ã‚Â³    rumors of unnatural canines on the prowl. Something has gone terribly   Ã‚Â³
 Ã‚Â³    wrong. Two S.T.A.R.S. teams (Special Tactics and Rescue Squad) are      Ã‚Â³
 Ã‚Â³    sent to investigate these strange and gruesome developments. Bravo      Ã‚Â³
 Ã‚Â³    Team mobilizes first and disappears almost immediately. Alpha Team      Ã‚Â³
 Ã‚Â³    follows, urgently driven towards the mansion. As either Chris Redfield  Ã‚Â³
 Ã‚Â³    or Jill Valentine, two valuable parts of the Alpha team, you work your  Ã‚Â³
 Ã‚Â³    way inside. Everything is quiet...too quiet.                            Ã‚Â³
 Ã‚Â³                                                                            Ã‚Â³
 Ã‚Â³    Thats right folks, Resident Evil..the game that sold over 1.4 million   Ã‚Â³
 Ã‚Â³    copies on the PSX is now on the PC.  Who else could bring you this      Ã‚Â³
 Ã‚Â³    QUALITY release?  Why, no-one Batman...just RAZOR 1911!  Quit           Ã‚Â³
 Ã‚Â³    fiddling with your joysticks and bust out the game-pads..Resident Evil  Ã‚Â³
 Ã‚Â³    is here to stay!	 	                                              Ã‚Â³
 Ã‚Â³                 							      Ã‚Â³	
 Ã‚Â³                                                                            Ã‚Â³
 Ã‚Â³                             Installation Guide                             Ã‚Â³
 Ã‚Â³                            ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~                            Ã‚Â³
 Ã‚Â³    Total installed size of this release is 270M.                           Ã‚Â³
 Ã‚Â³                                                                            Ã‚Â³
 Ã‚Â³    All of the SFX and speech have been left in as they are ESSENTIAL       Ã‚Â³
 Ã‚Â³    to gameplay (there are simply no subtitles).                            Ã‚Â³
 Ã‚Â³                                                                            Ã‚Â³
 Ã‚Â³    Q: What was ripped out and why?                                         Ã‚Â³
 Ã‚Â³    A: Movies and background music were removed. Background music will      Ã‚Â³
 Ã‚Â³       be available as an add-on pack for those who like that added         Ã‚Â³
 Ã‚Â³       atmosphere.                                                          Ã‚Â³
 Ã‚Â³                                                                            Ã‚Â³
 Ã‚Â³    To install the game, simply unzip all of the archives into a temporary  Ã‚Â³
 Ã‚Â³    directory, then use WinRAR or the UNRAR.EXE we supply to extract the    Ã‚Â³
 Ã‚Â³    archives to a game directory (there are long filenames, so be careful): Ã‚Â³
 Ã‚Â³                                                                            Ã‚Â³
 Ã‚Â³    e.g. unrar x -v -y resevil.001 c:resevil                               Ã‚Â³
 Ã‚Â³                                                                            Ã‚Â³
 Ã‚Â³    After the game has been uncompressed, run SETUP.EXE in your Resident    Ã‚Â³
 Ã‚Â³    Evil directory to select a video card and initialize your registry      Ã‚Â³
 Ã‚Â³    settings. Please see the README.TXT file supplied for information       Ã‚Â³
 Ã‚Â³    regarding video card selection.                                         Ã‚Â³
 Ã‚Â³                                                                            Ã‚Â³
 Ã‚Â³    Make a shortcut to the ResidentEvil.exe and you&#039;re ready to rock!       Ã‚Â³
 Ã‚Â³                                                                            Ã‚Â³
 Ã‚Â³    Check out KEYS.TXT for a list of the keyboard commands for the game.    Ã‚Â³
 Ã‚Â³                                                                            Ã‚Â³
 Ã‚Â³    NOTE: To use the 3D-accelerated versions of this game, make SURE you    Ã‚Â³
 Ã‚Â³    have DirectX v3.0b or better and the latest version of your video       Ã‚Â³
 Ã‚Â³    drivers installed, especially if you have a 3DFX card and/or            Ã‚Â³
 Ã‚Â³    DirectX v5.0: my Monster 3D would display weird clips of pictures       Ã‚Â³
 Ã‚Â³    until I installed the new drivers from Diamond.                         Ã‚Â³
 Ã‚Â³                                                                            Ã‚Â³
 Ã‚Â³                              Cracker&#039;s Notes                               Ã‚Â³
 Ã‚Â³                            ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~                            Ã‚Â³
 Ã‚Â³                                                                            Ã‚Â³
 Ã‚Â³    This game was nothing short of annoying to rip/crack. The game was      Ã‚Â³
 Ã‚Â³    coded in such a way as to make re-direction to a hard-drive tricky,     Ã‚Â³
 Ã‚Â³    and removal of movies a nightmare. The 3D acceleration for the game     Ã‚Â³
 Ã‚Â³    is all built into the .EXE directly EXCEPT the 3DFX support. For        Ã‚Â³
 Ã‚Â³    some reason, when you select a 3DFX card, the movie playing routines    Ã‚Â³
 Ã‚Â³    are mapped into the .EXE at runtime via a support file called           Ã‚Â³
 Ã‚Â³    BIOVFWUS.BIN. This was one of Paradigm&#039;s screwups: they simply didn&#039;t   Ã‚Â³
 Ã‚Â³    crack this file, and therefore their release doesn&#039;t support 3DFX.      Ã‚Â³
 Ã‚Â³    Their release also did not support non-accelerated video cards...       Ã‚Â³
 Ã‚Â³                                                                            Ã‚Â³
 Ã‚Â³    So, after fixing up the re-directions in the main executable and the    Ã‚Â³
 Ã‚Â³    support .BIN file, removing the CD-Checks and blanking the .AVI&#039;s, the  Ã‚Â³
 Ã‚Â³    game reached release quality, and hence, we decided to release a        Ã‚Â³
 Ã‚Â³    tested, working, and most importantly playable version of the game.     Ã‚Â³
 Ã‚Â³    Enjoy!                                                                  Ã‚Â³
 Ã‚Â³                                                                            Ã‚Â³
 Ã‚Â³                                                     - Beowulf              Ã‚Â³
 Ã‚Â³                                                                            Ã‚Â³
